Reviews.Title: “Decent budget option”
Reviews.Author: RobWinmar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights because it was a cheap option ($25) in a decent location. It's within walking distance of lots of good spots and is in an area with lots of food options. There are some prostitutes in nearby streets, but they're harmless. The room we had was pretty plain - just two beds, a tv, cabinet and bathroom, but it was sufficient for our needs. The bathroom is pretty simple as well. In our experience the internet only works in the lobby. We could not connect in the room at all. One real issue we had was the outsourced laundry facilities that they leave a brochure for in the rooms. We handed over a bag of clothes and got them back all nicely folded, but with a $75 bill. The manager said they would stop using that facility after our experience, so I hope that has occurred. The staff were helpful though (apart from when the night receptionist was talking on the phone for ages) and did speak English. It seems to be a popular place - walk ins were turned away when I was sitting in the lobby at night - and definitely serves its purpose as a reasonable place to stay for people on a budget. It's only an average hotel, but it's priced accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in the center of Mexico city”
Reviews.Author: Vienine Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Coming from Austria we stayed one night at arrival in Mexico and three nights before leaving the country. Clean and friendly reception. W-Lan - but only in the reception hall. Close to the metro-station Hildago. Small restaurant in the ground-floor. Great stay for little money!

Reviews.Title: “Will definetly go back”
Reviews.Author: Yalot70
Reviews.Content: great location, helpful employees, no language barrier

Reviews.Title: “Great place to recover from 24 hour bus ride...”
Reviews.Author: mirto_7
Reviews.Content: My cab driver from the bus station picked this hotel for me. It has excellent internet for wifi in the rooms. The windows open to let in a breeze. Walk a few blocks and you're at a huge shaded cement park with plumes of water shooting high into the air and children playing. My room was clean, maid came daily. I couldn't get the shower to work and feeling like a loon had to ask the bellboy who just held up the metal knob and water flowed. The next day it dawned on me that I had to keep it lifted for a long time for it to catch. The restaurant off the lobby is wonderful. A quirky place that I enjoyed very much.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: Towers015
Reviews.Content: Clean, confortable, near main streets and metro. Hotel New York was just what I was expecting. In a quiet neighbor it makes the perfect choice if your looking for a good place to rest after walking Mexico City o travelling nearby beautiful towns. Maybe if you're willing to make hotel life it's not the place, although it has a little restaurant/bar, but for U$25 a night, you can't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't ask who is on the top floor....”
Reviews.Author: Sappola
Reviews.Content: I may be breaching Mexican Security Guidelines here, but when I checked into the New York Hotel, I noticed the present of a rather heavily armed Marine. I should have walked out then, but the manager assured me that the Marine was there just to provide extra security for hotel guests. I didn't think much about it, as I was knew to Mexico City at the time, and checked in. Ater checking in, I saw 4-6 Marines walking around the hotel at all hours, and the occasional police officer. The Marines all carry machine guns. As I chatted with my wife in the lobby, one lazily sat across from me, drapping his gun across his lap...pointed directly at me. I'm sure the safety was on, but it is a little unnerving. Finally I found out what is going on: The New York Hotel has a deal with the government to periodically hold high level drug traffikers and kidnappers on their top floor, awaiting trial. It is a semi-prison. I think the ones they have are waiting to testify, and so the Marines are their to make sure they aren't a) sprung by their mates, and b) killed by their mates they are going to testify against. People around the hotel assured me it was safe. But they can't guarantee anything. Oh, and the internet access sucked here too.

Reviews.Title: “The City of New York should protest the use of its name”
Reviews.Author: emnadel
Reviews.Content: We have lived in central Mexico for 18 years and go to Mexico City often. 6 of us tried the Hotel New York and were disappointed. The interior rooms are dark and dreary. Furniture is old and could be described as "Salvation Army style." The bathrooms are small, and all of the water pipes are exposed. They don't give face towels, wash cloths, bathroom mat, tissues, bottled water or hairdryers. We have found better deals for a similar price. The carpet design was horrendous, and clashed with the bedspreads and draperies. The mattress was ok, but they don't have queen or king size beds. The choice is twin or double. The pillows were old and felt like cooked oatmeal.

Reviews.Title: “Single Female Traveler Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Mimi_in_Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Mexico City in April for four days as a single 25 year old female without a lick of Spanish. I felt very comfortable in this area of town on my own and was able to walk back and forth to the subway and resturants, etc. I found the staff helpful, and again, I speak no spanish. Not much in the way of ambiance but very clean. I even ate in the resturant once and while I wouldn't recommend it exactly, it was fine. My one complaint is that the hotel was a bit noisy at night. Thin walls and a room adjacent to an airshaft didn't help. But all in all, a good budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: NAURU
Reviews.Content: I moved from an $80 US per night hotel, which was so noisy I couldn't sleep, to the New York Hotel, which was only $32 per night. Well, it was a great move, because the New York Hotel was just as nice, but extremely quiet, and had friendlier service, and was so much cheaper. It is only about 200 metres from the Paseo de la Reforma, and about a 4 minute walk from the nearest subway (metro) station (Hidalgo). The price also includes a breakfast of eggs, toast and bacon/ham/sausage. I found the area to be safe at night. I will definitely stay at the New York Hotel next time I go to Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: walrus06
Reviews.Content: I don't remember how we found this place, probably one of the other budget hotels in this area that we go to was full. Clean,friendly and reasonably priced. Great resturant up the street on the corner. Very quiet and safe neighborhood. Close to the metro, and lots of small local bars ane restaurants. Not overrun with tourists, mostly famillies and business people. I hope it dosen't get too popular because we always count on it for a good place to stay for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: wudunn
Reviews.Content: I'v stayed on and off in this neighborhood for more than 20 years. The Oxford Where I always stayed and loved was looking a little shabby(but probably still a good low budget choice for 12 bucks)so I chose the New York just around the corner -What a treat! My 300 peso single was nicer than any hundred dollar room any where - Great helpful staff (it helps to know a little spanish) and the 7 or 8 block area surrounding the hotel is one of the most charming (albeit a bit down at the heel) safe and comfortable parts of this chaotic city midway between the zocalo and the zona rosa just a few minutes walk to the alameda and the great little restaurant Cafe Trevi -As far as I'm concerned - One of the best hotel deals ever

Reviews.Title: “Best Small Hotel in Mexico's Largest City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Among Mexico City's tall downtown buildings, sits one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. Only 45 rooms, but situated on an extremely quiet street, this hotel has wonderfully colorful room decor, comfortable accomodations, private baths and is convenient to tourists and businessmen alike. Close to Alameda Park, the Zocalo and other attractions and nightlife- the Hotel New York is situated in an extremely ideal location. A small but cozy restaurant is often quite busy and each room has a 27 inch color television. I highly recommend this hotel while visiting Mexico City.

HotelInfo.Name: New York Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Edison 45 | Tabacalera, Mexico City 06030, Mexico
